BodyName: Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Comment: Continuation of the November 10, 2014 - Recessed Meeting

Items.Title: Continuation of the November 10, 2014 - Recessed Meeting

Application No. 20155018 HKK (N 150068 HKK) pursuant to Section 3020 of the New York City Charter, concerning the designation by the Landmarks Preservation Commission of the Ridgewood Lodge No. 710, Free and Accepted Masons, 1054 Bushwick Avenue, a/k/a 1122 Gates Avenue,  (Designation List 473/LP-2541), Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 4, Council District 34.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 1054 Bushwick Ave, a/k/a 1122 Gates Ave, Brooklyn (20155018 HKK (N 150068 HKK))

Items.Title: Application no. C 140360 PSK submitted by the Mayor’s Office of Criminal Justice Coordinator and NYC Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS), pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the site selection of property located at 444 Thomas S. Boyland Street (Block 3496, Lot 4), for use as a community justice center, Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 16, Council District 41. This application is subject to the review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 444 Thomas S. Boyland St, Brooklyn (C 140360 PSK)

Items.Title: Application no. C 140388 PCX submitted by the NYC Department of Parks and Recreation and NYC Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS), pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the site selection and acquisition of property located at 850 East 138th Street (Block 2589, Lot 31), for a repair, maintenance and storage facility, Borough of Bronx, Community Board 1, Council District 17. This application is subject to the review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Application no. 20155175 CCK, application by The Green-Wood Cemetery, pursuant to Section 1506 of the New York State Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, for approval of the acquisition of land located at 242 25th Street, Borough of Brooklyn, for non-burial purposes, Community Board 7, Council District 38.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Application no. 20155169 HHM, application by NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation (HHC), pursuant to Section 7385(6) of the HHC Enabling Act, for approval to lease 105,682 square feet of land on the campus of The Metropolitan Hospital Center, located at 1918 First Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, for development of low-income housing, Community Board 11, Council District 9.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Application No. 20155018 HKK (N 150068 HKK) pursuant to Section 3020 of the New York City Charter, concerning the designation by the Landmarks Preservation Commission of the Ridgewood Lodge No. 710, Free and Accepted Masons, 1054 Bushwick Avenue, a/k/a 1122 Gates Avenue,  (Designation List 473/LP-2541), Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 4, Council District 34.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved by Subcommittee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 1054 Bushwick Ave, a/k/a 1122 Gates Ave, Brooklyn (20155018 HKK (N 150068 HKK))

Items.Title: Application no. C 140360 PSK submitted by the Mayor’s Office of Criminal Justice Coordinator and NYC Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS), pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the site selection of property located at 444 Thomas S. Boyland Street (Block 3496, Lot 4), for use as a community justice center, Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 16, Council District 41.
